file_content.text: You here to take Barrows off my hands?
I noted your return. I figured it was safe to assume you were successful, given your reputation.
I've prepared a report of your success for Darth Tormen. I have your compensation right here.
It's been a pleasure working with you, Lieutenant.
Thank you.
Likewise. I admit that I assumed your reputation exaggerated. I see I was mistaken.
I could use a friend in Imperial Intelligence. Keep in touch.
You do good work.
So long as you're sure to put in a good word for me, I'll do that.
I handled more than just Zale.
I'm afraid Darth Tormen has absolute authority on the matter.
However, I could probably procure something with a little time. Is there anything in particular?
I'd like to know a little more about my employer.
Tell me about Darth Tormen.
That's a dangerous request. Unofficially, I can tell you that any concerns you may have are largely unfounded.
Darth Tormen has little tolerance for duplicity. If he bore you any ill will, he'd simply crush you like a bug and move on.
Deal honestly with him and you'll live longer.
I'll be sure to keep that in mind, Lieutenant.
Noted.
I'll rest a little easier knowing I'm not getting hung out to dry.
That's good to hear.
Don't fault me if I keep my cards close to my vest.
I'll never trust a Sith.
I can't fault someone for being smart.
New toys are nice.
I'm certain I can dig up something you'll like.
Money, plain and simple.
I'm sure there are some funds I can reallocate without much fuss.
Just be sure to mention me favorably to my superiors.
I must return to my duties. Again, a pleasure.
Horn, I'm in position. What have you got for me?
Analysis of data from the custodians is coming slowly, but I believe we've found a solid lead.
The bulk of the samples taken recently appear to have been interred in a vault we are designating "block 44."
The majority of the Imperial prisoners have likely been taken there, making it the probable destination for your target.
Where can I find block 44?
Give me the location.
These coordinates are based on our analysis of the tomb's schematics, but that's as much as I know.
If Barrows came to stop the Imperial rescue op, shouldn't he be after the highest profile targets?
What about the Dread Masters?
It's possible, but with the majority of our forces concentrating on liberating the Dread Masters, it's unlikely he'd go unnoticed.
And the remaining samples?
What happened to the rest?
Operations Groups One and Two identified a separate vault as the location of the Dread Masters. Other samples were separated as well, though the reasons are unclear.
Any of them could be a potential target, but our primary objective is the Dread Masters. It's unlikely Barrows would go unnoticed.
I don't like working with "most likely," Lieutenant.
You don't sound real certain.
My apologies. Deciphering the data is proving difficult. It's the best we have to work with.
It's your call. These are block 44's coordinates if you decide to pursue it as a lead.
If Barrows is sighted elsewhere, you'll be the first to know. Horn out.
Our landers can insert you into the Republic fortifications relatively near the last known location of Barrows's vessel.
Get me on the ground, Lieutenant.
Good, I'm ready to head out.
What am I walking into?
You'll be heading for a starship hangar in the administrative wing. Expect resistance.
They won't know what hit them.
We have already disrupted the Republic's ability to maintain control of their captives; the biggest threat to you will likely be the prisoners themselves.
It will be absolute pandemonium planetside. This is my direct holofrequency. I am on call should you need me.
Um, Blizz like it if boss tell Blizz what Empire-man's funny words mean on flight down.
Not often I find myself breaking into prisons. Shall we?
Won't be dull.
Secret prison fortress, absolute pandemonium, how bad could it be?
Lieutenant Horn, Imperial Intelligence. I have orders to act as your liaison.
I've prepared a briefing should you require it.
Start from the beginning; I haven't been given a lot of details.
Go ahead.
I'll take all the help I can get.
Great, thanks.
Then allow me to introduce you to your target.
This is Zale Barrows. After helping break the Mandalorian blockade during the war, the Republic offered him considerable latitude to plague the Empire.
Feh, only suckers took them up on that "Privateer" racket. There's no profit in chasing Sith warships.
Owe him a bloody lip.
Then, after the Treaty of Coruscant, the Republic retained him as their unofficial ferryman to Belsavis.
You have a location for Barrows's ship?
Where is he now?
We observed his freighter land on Belsavis before our forces invaded; no vessels larger than a shuttle have been spotted leaving the surface.
Why would the Republic hire a war hero to run errands?
Seems like a waste of talent.
Their operations here are strictly off the books. Using Barrows ensures nothing here can be traced back to the Republic.
Sounds like a glorified shuttle pilot.
I'm not impressed.
Nearly half the ship captains involved in breaking the blockade became Republic-sponsored pirates. Under Barrows's leadership, they harried the Imperial fleet mercilessly.
Belsavis is a remote ice ball with minimal natural resources--the perfect place to keep things you'd rather forget.
Which is why the Republic has constructed a substantial prison fortress here to hide away their undesirables.
I'm not looking to lay siege. What are our options?
We have a plan to break in?
If it's just a prison, why all the Imperial interest?
There has to be more to it.
We think there may be more to this prison, but our primary objective is to extract persons of interest.
I assume we're talking about more than swoop gang scum.
What kind of "undesirables"?
Top organized crime figures, mass murderers, hostile species, political prisoners. Anyone the Republic would like to disappear.
That includes a large number of Imperial prisoners of war the Republic did not wish to release after the Treaty of Coruscant.
Hit the high points. Quickly.
Just give the bare essentials.
Your target is Zale Barrows, ace pilot and daring as they come. His vessel was observed landing on Belsavis before our forces invaded.
We believe he is still inside the Republic prison facility on the surface.
